title: Bug 116744: Dynamic text content type has no effect
OB: The report displays the same results regardless of the dynamic text element's Content Type property.
EB:
The report should display different results based on the dynamic text element's Content Type property:

- When Content Type is set to Plain, the literal content (tags and all) should be displayed.
- When Content Type is set to Auto, content 1, 2, and 3 should appear properly without any HTML or RTF tags.
- When Content Type is set to HTML, content 1 and 2 should appear properly without any HTML tags, and content 3 should appear literally with RTF tags.

The attached report does not show the expected behavior.
SR:
1. Open the attached report.
2. Modify the dynamic text element's Content Type property to Plain.
3. Verify that the literal content (tags and all) is displayed.
4. Modify the dynamic text element's Content Type property to Auto.
5. Verify that content 1, 2, and 3 appear properly without any HTML or RTF tags.
6. Modify the dynamic text element's Content Type property to HTML.
7. Verify that content 1 and 2 appear properly without any HTML tags, and content 3 appears literally with RTF tags.
